Both of them are working together in the business to make it grow.  Mayra is asking for financing to buy clothing for women and men, cosmetics, sandals and pants, among others.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women and men, cosmetics, sandals and pants, among others.

loans.name: Claudia  Patricia

texts.es: Claudia invirtió su primer credikiva en la compra de nuevos video juegos y de mercancía con la que surtió su negocio, posteriormente compró dos consolas. Ella está muy satisfecha y comprará con su nuevo credikiva, mercancia tales como accesorios, ropa, productos para el cuidado personal, papelería, detalles y variedades, para invertir en la miscelanea, ya que desea surtir las vitrinas y aprovechar la temporada escolar que se avecina. Ella envia un mensaje a los fianciadores de Kivas: " Estoy agradecida con la oportunidad que me han dado nuevamente para invertir en mi microempresa, he crecido y desarrollado mi negocio. "
texts.en: Claudia used her first Kiva loan to buy new video games and merchandise to stock her business; later she bought two consoles.  She’s very satisfied and will use her new Kiva loan to buy merchandise like accessories, clothes, personal care items, stationery supplies, decorations and miscellaneous items to stock her general store because she wants to stock her display cases and take advantage of the approaching school term.  She sends a message to Kiva lenders:  “I am very grateful for the opportunity you have given me once again to invest in my micro business; my business has grown and developed.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise like accessories, clothes, personal care items, tationery supplies, decorations and miscelaneous items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic bags.

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 55 years old. She lives in a small village near Tbilisi (capital city of the country) with her husband, Levan. The main source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have a milk cow. Rusudan produces yogurt and sells it in village stores. 

Also, the family owns a greenhouse with an area of 300 square meters. During winter and spring, the greenhouse is used for greens-growing. In summer and fall months cucumbers and tomatoes are grown there. All harvested products are sold in Tbilisi. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Rusudan requested the credit for renovation of the greenhouse. She has to change the polyethylene cover, as well as fix the wooden construction. When the greenhouse is renovated, it will keep the needed temperature and the family will harvest more products. It will increase their income from sales. 

Rusudan and Levan plan to use the increase in income for purchasing necessary household goods in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse renovation.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es: Enith, de 48 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora empeñosa y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Esta separada del padre de sus hijos, pero vive en compañía de ellos en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Enith es la venta de ropa de damas y caballeros, mercadería que compra en la ciudad de Lima. Para ello realiza viajes cada mes para comprar sus productos, escogiendo los mejores modelos y a la moda, y para luego venderlos en su casa a sus vecinos familiares. En ocasiones su mercadería lo vende a crédito a 30 días y pocas al contado, de esa manera ha estado trabajando por más de 03 años. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico, como también de disponer de tiempo libre para dedicarlo a otras actividades, iniciándose por la idea de su hija quien también se dedica a ese negocio y viendo las ganancias que le deja decidió arriesgarse y ahora viendo que le resulta tiene planes de abrir una tienda de venta de ropa. Este será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa a precio por mayor.
texts.en:
Enith, 48, is a hardworking, enterprising, determined woman with a strong Desire to get ahead.  She’s separated from her children’s father but lives with them in her own house.  Enith’s activity is selling clothes that she buys in the city of Lima for women and men.  To do so, she travels there every month to buy her products choosing the best, most fashionable styles to then sell them at home to her neighbors and family members.  Occasionally she sells her merchandise on 30-day credit and some for cash; she’s been working this way for over three years.  She likes the business because it allows her to have steady income and also free time to do other things.  She started out thanks to an idea of her daughter’s who also works in this business and noting the profits she earned she decided to risk it and now that she too is having good results she’s planning to open a clothing store.

This will be MFP loan #4 so she hopes for your collaboration in order to make her plans a reality.  She feels good in her communal bank because she considers them to be a united, supportive group.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women and men.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer amable y trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Teofilo quien es técnico en enfermería, vive en compañía de su pareja, sus dos hijas y sus 02 nietos, habitando juntos en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Ofelia es la venta de verduras y plátanos,  para eso cuenta con una mesa que instala en el frontis de su casa, donde atiende de manera muy amable y cordial a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Se inició en éste negocio por la necesidad económica que atravesaba, pero gracias al  apoyo de su pareja ha logrado salir de la pobreza. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha permitido salir de sus apuros económicos así como poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando algunas veces no puedo vender todo su producto por lo que se llega a malograr, pero eso no la desanima y realiza mejor sus cálculos de sus ventas para comprar lo necesario y no se descomponga, además tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. Este será el prestando número 10 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para poder concretar su planes. Por otro lado, se siente cómodo con su grupo comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en compra de plátanos y verduras a precio por mayor para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Ofelia, 57, is a kind, hardworking woman with a strong Desire to get ahead.  She lives with Teofilo who is a nursing technician.  She lives with him, her two daughters and her two grandsons together in her own house.

Ofelia is a vegetable and banana merchant.  She has a table set up in front of her house where she kindly and cordially tends to her customers who for the most part are her neighbors.  She stared in this business due to the economic need she was going through but thanks to support from her spouse she’s managed to emerge from poverty.  She likes the business because it’s made it possible for her to get out from economic tight spots as well as help her spouse with household expenses.  On the other hand, she doesn’t much like it when she doesn’t manage to sell out all her merchandise and it spoils.  This does not discourage her, though, and she tries to make the best possible calculations of her sales so that she only buys what is necessary and so that it won’t spoil.  Besides, she plans to expand the business and increase sales.

This will be MFP loan #10.  She feels grateful for the financial support to reach her goals.  On the other hand, she is comfortable with her communal group because she considers it to be unified and supportive.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy bananas and vegetables at wholesale prices so that her profit margin will be larger.

loans.use: to buy bananas and vegetables.

loans.name: Zoila Ramona

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Chicas Fresas, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad y las socias son muy amables y trabajadoras.

En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 41 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos mayores y tres de 16, 14 y 8  años los mismos que estudian en universidad los mayores, dos en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa,  allí vente todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergente, productos  de bazar, etc. Por las tardes también vende ciertos alimentos preparados pero solo en temporada de clases ya que está cerca de un colegio,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 23h00, sus hijos  le ayudan en su trabajo ya que a veces resulta muy cansado para ella sola, lleva más de 15 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, artículos de bazar y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio. 

Su sueño es ver realizados a sus hijos por lo cual lucha dia a dia.
texts.en:
The members of the “Chicas Fresas” communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s San Pablo neighborhood.  This is a densely populated marginal urban zone in this city; the members are very kind and hardworking.

Zoila, 41, lives her.  She’s in a common law relationship and has five children; two are adults and the other three are 16, 14 and 8 years old.  The older ones attend university, two are in secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a grocery store at home where she sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, kitchen supplies, etc.   In the afternoons she also sells prepared food but only during the school year because she’s near a school.  She works every day from 6am until 11pm.  Her children help her at work because it’s sometimes very tiring for her by herself.  She’s been in business over 15 years and does very well.

She will use this loan to better stock her store; she will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, kitchen supplies and other basic staples.  She’s been in the communal bank two years and likes it because the loans have helped her business very much.  Her dream is to see her children fulfilled and this is what she strives for day to day.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items to stock her store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 29 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, así como alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Amelia quien se dedica a la venta de comida, fruto de esa unión tiene una hija de 5 años, habitando juntos en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Juan es la venta de comidas con su pareja, para ello instalan una mesa en el frontis de un aserradero, donde brinda sus platillos a los trabajadores del aserradero así como los transeúntes. Llevan realizando éste negocio cerca de 03 años contando con la ayuda de su pareja. Le agrada su negocio pues le ha permitido generarse un ingreso económico para pagarse su gastos. Manifiesta que se inició con préstamo particular, con el tiempo ha logrado establecerse en el negocio y ahora goza de las ganacias que le genera. Tienen planes de alquilar un local y abrir un restaurante, donde puedan brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y se puedan sentirse mas cómodos. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Se siente contento de con grupo solidario pues lo considera unido y responsable. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes como arroz, azúcar y demás a precio por mayor.
texts.en:
Juan, 29, is a hardworking and diligent man, as well as a happy one, with a great desire to succeed. He lives with his partner, Amelia, who sells meals, and they have a 5 year old daughter. They live together in their own house.

Juan sells meals with his partner. They have set up their stand at the front of a lumber mill where they offer food to mill workers as well as passersby. They have been doing this work together for nearly 3 years. He likes the business because it has enabled him to generate income to pay expenses. He notes that it was started with a private loan and that in time he has succeeded in stabilizing the business and now they enjoy the profits it generates. They have plans to rent a space and open a restaurant where they can provide better service to their customers who will be able to sit down more comfortably. 

This will be loan no. 3 from MFP and he hopes for your collaboration so that he can continue meeting his goals. He is pleased with the communal bank since he considers it united and responsible. He will invest the amount requested in the purchase of ingredients wholesale, such as rice, sugar and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and canned food.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mavi

texts.es: Mavi, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Además de amable y cordial con muchos deseos de progresar, está separada del padre de sus hijos, vive en compañía de ellos en la casa de su padre. La actividad que realiza Mavi es la venta de repuestos para motos, para esto cuenta con un taller de mecánica que es de su hermano y ella tiene un espacio acodiciando, donde puede proveer a los clientes repuestos para la reparación de sus motos. Este taller está instalado en la casa de su padre, desde hace 5 años, donde atiende ella en la venta y su hermano brinda el servicio en el taller. Le gusta su actividad pues le genera  un ingreso económico regular para pagar los gastos de su hogar, así como le permite tener una ocupación, además de ver una oportunidad de negocio por la facilidad de brindarles los repuestos a los clientes del taller de su hermano. Por eso viendo que tiene ganancias adecuadas tiene planes de incursionar en otro negocio, como es la venta de ropa de segunda mano. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para motos para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: 33-year-old Mavi is a hard-working woman. In addition to being friendly and cordial and really desiring to progress, she is separated from her children’s father and lives with them in her father’s home. Mavi’s business is selling spare parts for motorcycles for which she has a coveted space in her brother’s body shop where she can provide customers with the spare parts to fix their motorcycles. This body shop has been located in her father’s home for the last five years. She takes care of the sales and her brother provides the servicing in the workshop. She likes her business as it generates a regular income to pay the household expenses as well as allowing her to have an occupation, in addition to seeing a business opportunity in the ease of providing the spare parts to her brother’s workshop. Seeing that she makes adequate profits, she has plans to venture into another business like selling second-hand clothing. This will be her second loan with MFP, so she expects to have their collaboration to continue with her objectives. She is also comfortable with her communal bank since she considers it a united and supportive group. With the amount solicited, 800 new Peruvian soles, she will invest in the purchase of spare motorcycle parts to stock up her business.

loans.use: Comprar repuestos para motos.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yoconda Monserrate

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Chicas Fresas, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

En este lugar vive la señora Yoconda, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 12,  9 y 4 años de edad, ellos estudian en  colegio y en escuela. Su esposo es técnico en refrigeración.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días sobretodo en las mañanas que le resulta más fácil y también vende en su casa, deja a crédito y  cobra cada ocho o quince días,  lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien por lo cual tiene que viajar hasta dos veces al mes a  Guayaquil a comprar su mercadería porque allá es más barato.
 
Este crédito es para  comprar pantalones, trajes de baño, bermudas, camisetas, blusas entre otras prendas de vestir, en especial la ropa de temporada. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos años  y le gusta por la oportunidad que le dan para sacar su negocio adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo’s San Pablo neighborhood the members of the “Chicas Fresas” communal bank meet every two weeks.  This is a densely populated marginal urban zone in this city.

Yoconda lives here.  She’s 36 years old, married and has four children who are 17, 12, 9 and 4 years old.  They attend secondary school and elementary school.  Her husband is a refrigeration technician.

She is a merchant; she sells all types of clothes door to door.  She works every day especially during the morning which is when it’s easier for her; she also sells at home.  She sells on credit and collects payments weekly or biweekly.  She’s been in this activity for three years and does very well so she must travel to Guayaquil twice a month to buy her merchandise because it’s less expensive there.

This loan is to buy pants, bathing suits, Bermuda shorts, t-shirts and blouses, among other articles of clothing especially seasonal clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for two years and likes it because of the opportunity it gives her to move her business ahead.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy pants, bathing suits, Bermuda shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Wilson quien es empleado estatal, fruto de esa unión tiene dos hijos que son motivación. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Elvira en la venta de comida, como desayuno y almuerzo, para eso cuenta con un puesto en el puerto de los areneros, donde instala todos los días su mesa y atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes y demás transeúntes. Por otro lado ofrece también comida a los trabajadores de las empresas de la zona. Tiene más de 04 realizando éste negocio, y hasta el momento tiene el apoyo de una señorita a la que paga por día un monto de 10 nuevos soles, brindando así una ocupación a otras personas. Le gusta su negocio pues ha logrado hacerse conocida en la zona por su buena atención y su dedicación al trabajo, logrando así ser reconocida en la zona, además de los ingresos económicos que le deja para poder pagar sus gastos y mantener  a su familia.  Por lo contrario no le agrada cuando llueve demasiado y dificulta en buen transito, pero no se desanima y tiene planes de alquilar un local donde pueda atender de manera más cómoda a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues le gusta el trabajo que realiza apoyando a las personas. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de comidas como arroz, azúcar, aceites y demás.
texts.en:
Elvira, aged 54, is a hard-working, diligent woman with a great desire to improve her position in life. She lives with Wilson, who is a government employee, and the couple have two children, who spur them on. They live comfortably in their own home. Elvira’s work consists in selling food, i.e. breakfast and lunch from a stall at the river port, where she sets up a table every day and serves both regular customers and passers-by with a smile. In addition, she provides food for workers from nearby companies. 

She is currently assisted by another woman, whom she pays 10 PEN per day, so Elvira is providing work for someone else. She likes her job because she has succeeded in gaining a reputation for good customer service and professional commitment, which has won her recognition in the area as well as an income that lets her cover her costs and support her family. Although she doesn’t like it when too much rain falls, causing traffic problems, she doesn’t let it get her down. Elvira has plans to rent premises for her business, so that she can serve her clients in a more comfortable environment. 

This will be her second loan with the organisation MFP. She hopes that MFP will assist her so that she can put her plans into action. She says she is happy with her community bank, because she approves of the way in which it supports people. She is requesting a loan of 800 PEN, which she will invest in ingredients such as rice, sugar, oils etc., all of which she needs to prepare meals.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oils and canned goods.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is from the village of Garikula, East Georgia. She is 53 years old and lives with her family: her husband Avtandil, and two sons (25 and 17 years old). All adult family members are involved in the family's farming activities, which are the main source of the income for the family. Tamar’s younger son goes to school. 

Tamar, Avtandil and their elder son spend almost whole days on the family farm. They have two milk cows and a bull. Tamar produces cheese and yogurt and sells it locally, in the village. Also, the family owns a small pig farm with three pigs. They sell on average 20 piglets per year. Along with the aforementioned, Tamar’s husband uses the bull for transporting wood from the forest, which is sold in the village – villagers use it for heating their houses during winter months. 

The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. Tamar requested credit for purchasing another bull. Her husband will be able to take more wood from the forest and increase the family’s income. They plan to reinvest the profit in the family's farm development, in order to make it more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia is from the village of Khashmi, East Georgia. He is 42 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife named Tamara, his 18-year-old daughter and his 16-year-old son. 

Tamara leads the agricultural business of the family, which is one of the important sources of income for the family. Ilia is also actively involved in family farming. They own a dairy farm with 4 milk cows. Tamara produces cheese and sells it in the village to dairy products retailers. In spring and summer seasons, Ilia rents a tractor and provides tilling, moving and other seasonal works to neighbor farmers for a certain fee. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris.

Ilia requested credit for purchasing a tractor. Once he has his own tractor, he won’t have to pay rent for it and the income of the family will increase. Ilia and Tamara plan to make some savings from the increased income for investing in the dairy farm, in order to raise its profitability and improve family living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Manuel tiene 60 años de edad, es casado con tres hijos. Tiene 42 años de experiencia en el medio artístico como cantante, él aprendió con su abuelo, pero mejoro y aprendió aún más con un maestro, quien lo perfecciono en instrumentos musicales como la guitarra. Manuel toca en bares y restaurantes de lunes a sábado de 8:00 p.m. a 2:00 a.m. a personas que asisten a departir y que les gusta escuchar música de todo tipo. Él tiene un dúo con otro amigo y cantan dos canciones por $5.00.

Don Manuel solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para realizar mejoras y comprar piezas dañadas y llantas a su microbús, ya que es su medio de transporte para trabajar, por que el trabajo de noche es peligroso movilizarse a pie. Teniendo en buenas condiciones su microbús él estará seguro de poder asistir a varios restaurantes en una sola noche, ya que si no hay suficiente demanda de su música en un lugar se traslada a otro y así contara con ingresos para subsistir. De esos ingresos el ahorra una parte para que sus hijos estudien una carrera académica y brindarles la oportunidad que él no tubo.
texts.en:
Manuel, 60, is married and has three children.  He has 42 years’ experience in the artistic world as a singer.   He learned from his grandfather but improved and learned still more from a teacher who perfected his musical instruments, like the guitar.  Manuel plays in bars and restaurants from Monday through Saturday from 8pm until 2am for people who attend them to relax and who like to listen to all types of music.  He and a friend form a duet and they sing two songs for $5.00.

Manuel is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to replace damaged parts and repair his minivan because it’s his mode of transportation for work because he works nights and it’s dangerous to move about on foot.  If his minivan is in good operating condition he’s able to visit several restaurants in a single night so if his music isn’t in high demand in one place he can move on to another and earn income to subsist.  From this income, he uses part of it so that his children can study academic careers and to provide them with opportunities he never had.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his minivan.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene detenida la construcción de unos cuartos en la planta alta de su vivienda por falta de material. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para comprar el material que es arena, cemento y varilla y así terminar las recamaras que serán para sus hijos. 
Don Juan trabajo desde hace varios años en una bodega en la vecina ciudad, como encargado, y su esposa se encarga del cuidado y atención de sus dos hijos que tiene. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia y que tengan un lugar seguro
texts.en:
Juan has stopped the construction of some rooms on the top floor of his house because he does not have the materials. This is why he is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as sand, cement and pipes and thus to finish the bedrooms that will be for his children.

Juan has been working for some years in a warehouse facility in a city nearby, as manager, and his wife is in charge of caring and attending to the two children that he has. 

He wants to improve the family assets and to have a safe place.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sand, cement and pipes so he can continue building on the top floor of his house

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is from a small village in East Georgia. She is 53 years old and lives with her family: husband – Tariel, a 30-year-old son, a daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (6 and 2 years old). 

Nani works as a salesperson in a village store. Along with her main job, she is actively involved in the family agricultural business. The family has a pig and they sell on average 10 piglets per year. Also they have 10 sheep and sell lambs. Nani’s husband works as a distributor at a local bread bakery. He takes bread to nearby villages in his own car and distributes it amongst local stores. His salary isn’t fixed and depends on the amount of distributed bread. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Nani requested credit for purchasing a new car for her husband. He will sell his old car and buy a bigger one. He can put more bread in a new car and save on transportation costs. It will increase his income, as will distribute more bread with the same cost on transportation. With the increased income, the family will be able to purchase more household goods, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car for business use

loans.name: Nestan

texts.en:
Nestan is 33 years old. She lives in the village of Sartichala, East Georgia with her family: her husband named Josef, and three sons (16, 14 and 3 years old). The elder children go to the village school. Nestan is leading the agricultural business of the family; they have a small dairy farm with 4 milk cows. Nestan produces cheese and sells it in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Nestan’s husband works as a driver. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Nestan requested credit for purchasing a tractor. Josef will provide various seasonal agricultural services to farmers with the purchased tractor. He will get service fees and the family will have additional income. The family’s total income will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long is 52 years old. She is an old, single mother who always takes care of the family. She lives permanently in Prey Chor district with a married daughter, whose husband is a construction worker. Mrs. Long is in the business of cultivating rice to generate her income. She approximately earns $2.00 per day from her business. 

Mrs. Long would like to take out her loan from our lenders to purchase construction supplies for her son-in-law, whose materials were ruined while working last time. Mrs. Long hopes that her family’s situation will be better by using the loan from HKL.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her son-in-law

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: El señor Gabriel y su familia son unas personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras , el  junto  con su esposa  se  dedican  a  la  venta  de   ropa  usada   lo cual  les  a  permitido  sacar  a  su  familia  adelante, ellos  están  muy contentos  de habernos  encontrado   ya que  requieren realizar  la  compra   de  mercancía,  ven  en  el crédito  la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio   generando  mayores  ingresos   los  cuales  le  permitan  ofrecer a  sus  pequeños  una  excelente  calidad  de  vida.
texts.en: Gabriel and his family are hardworking and entrepreneurial people, together with his wife he sells used clothing which has allowed them get their family ahead, they are very happy to have found Kiva because they want to buy merchandise and they see the loan as the possibility to grow the business generating more income which will allow them to offer their children an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganchimeg, 41, sells dairy products in the bazaar. She has been involved in her business for 5 years and already has had many customers. She lives with her family in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Ganchimeg always purchases her products such as milk and yogurt from her permanent suppliers, who are herders in the Mongolian countryside. 

Soon it will be Lunar Year, which is a Mongolian traditional respectful celebration, and demand of the dairy products will be increased notably during the holidays. Therefore, Ganchimeg wants to prepare her sales products for the celebration. It is a good time to increase her sales volume. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the dairy products in a large amount for increasing her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products in a large amount for increasing her sales volume

loans.name: Bold

texts.en: Mr. Bold, 45, is a taxi car driver around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business for 16 years. He lives with his family in the slum district of the city. Bold needed some money to repair some of the car's damages and change old spare parts. It is an important thing to his service quality and customers' satisfaction. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase necessary spare parts for his taxi car's repair.

loans.use: to purchase necessary spare parts for his taxi car

loans.name: Caritas Alegres (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Caritas Alegres está formado por 10 socias quienes laboran en un mercado de la ciudad, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca ciudad que es conocida como la Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es una ciudad muy rica por su Cultura y Tradiciones, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraño. Su gente es amable, gentil y de un gran carisma, como nuestras socias quienes son mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras que buscan en el trabajo del día a día las mejores oportunidades para salir  adelante con sus Familias. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Martha, tiene 27 años, es madre soltera  de 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 7 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

La Señora. Martha trabaja en  un puesto en el mercado donde venden papas por el cual le pagan un sueldo mensual, trabajo en el que se encuentra hace 15 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 7  de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y su crédito lo va a invertir en los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
 
Su meta es  tener un negocio propio de venta de papas ya que conoce el negocio.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una socia que por motivos de salud no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Caritas Alegres is made up of 10 members who work in a market in the city. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca that is known as Saint Anne of the four rivers. Since December 1999, it is a Cultural Heritage Site. It is a city rich in culture and traditions. Its gastronomic variety captures the palate of natives and foreigners. Its people are friendly, kind and very charismatic, like our members, who are fighting, entrepreneurial women that look, in their daily work, for the best opportunities that will get their families ahead.

One of the members of the group is Martha. She is 27 years old and a single mother of three children who are 12, 10 and 7 years old. All her children study in the city school. They do not have their own house, so they rent.

Martha works in the market selling potatoes, for which they pay her a monthly salary. She has been working in this job for 15 years. She works from Sunday to Sunday from 7 in the morning until 7 at night.

In the communal bank, she is in her second loan cycle and will invest her loan in her children’s schooling expenses.

Her goal is to have her own business selling potatoes, since she knows the business already.

The small photo attached is of a member who, for health reasons, was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonbaatar, 31, runs a freight transportation business. He started his business last year and always carries heavy luggage and things between the cities or regions. His truck is a main tool for his business and he always takes care for its wholeness and safety. 

For a while, he has not made any routine maintenance to his truck. He thinks now it is time to make some repairs and adjustments for his truck's safety and normality. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase the necessary spare parts for his truck's repair.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as bread, hotdogs, and cheese for her business. Gina has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to buy a tricycle for her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as bread, hotdogs, and cheese for her business.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is a 62-year-old widow with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Pilar runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy more items such as soft-drinks, sugar, and other groceries for resale.

Pilar has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns income from e-loading and rice retailing.

Pilar aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items such as soft-drinks, sugar, and other groceries for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 44 years old and two of her children are in school.

Evelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old.  She is married to Joseph and together they are blessed with four children.

Mary is a fishmonger in Babadogo, Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last two years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,900. Mary is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD to expand her business

Mary hopes to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 27 years old and from Ndunyu-Njeru.  He is a single man.

David is a farmer and has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides and also to help him pay for labor.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seed and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old from Nakuru and is married with three children, who are aged between 21 years and six years old.

Esther sells bananas and has been doing it for many years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more bananas to add to her stock.

She hopes to venture into other fruit-selling businesses.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for selling

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Roger quien es comerciante. Vive con sus padres, su pareja y sus 03 hijos de 16, 14 y 10 años de edad, habitando en su propia casa.  La actividad que realiza Mariela es la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, así como de niños de los mas diversos modelos y presentaciones. Toda esa ropa le envía su hermana quien vive en la ciudad de Lima, buscando lo ultimo en la moda, para que luego Mariela los venda desde su casa a sus  vecinas, amistades y familiares, además de salir a ofrecer de forma ambulante por otras zonas de la ciudad. Su ventas son a crédito o contado, logrando hacerse conocida en los 10 años que tiene en el negocio. 
Le gusta su negocio pues se siente independiente contando con un ingreso propio para apoyar a  su pareja con los gastos del hogar, como también el tiempo libre del cual dispone para poder dedicarlos al cuidado de sus hijos. Por lo contrario, menciona que le incomoda cuando algunos de sus clientes se retrasa en el pago de su créditos, pero esto no deja que afecta con sus compromisos. Ahora tiene planes de hacer crecer mas su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por  otro lado, se siente cómoda con su banco comunal  pues le gusta el trabajo que realizan apoyando a las personas. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para la venta como ropa para eso enviará su dinero a su hermana quien le hará las compras buscando los precios más bajos para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
39-year-old Mariela is a hard-working woman who really desires to get ahead. Her partner is Roger, who is a merchant. She lives with her parents, her partner and her 3 children who are 6, 14 and 10 years old. They live in their own home. Mariela’s business is selling ladies', men’s and children’s clothing of the most diverse models and styles. All this clothing is sent to her by her sister who lives in the city of Lima, searching for the latest fashion so that later Mariela can sell it from her home to her neighbors, friends and acquaintances. In addition she goes out and sells them in other areas of the city. Her sales are made on credit or for cash, and she has made herself known in the 10 years that she has had this business.
She likes her business since she feels independent having her own income to support her partner in the household expenses as well as because of the free time she has to be able to raise her children. On the contrary, she mentions that it is uncomfortable when some of her customers get behind on their payments, but this does not stop her from fulfilling her commitments. Now, she has plans to grow her business more. This will be her second loan with the MFP institution, so she hopes for their collaboration in other to continue with her objectives. Additionally, she feels comfortable with the communal bank since she likes the work they do supporting people. With the 800 new Peruvian soles requested, she will invest in merchandise for sale, like clothing. She will send the money to her sister who will make the purchases for her searching for the lowest prices in order to have the greatest profit.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling firewood and charcoal. Juanita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy frames and other materials for her basket weaving business.

Flora has been in this business for 2 years. Flora earns additional income from hog raising.

Flora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy frames and other materials for basket weaving

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for selling

loans.name: Ma.glenda

texts.en:
Ma.Glenda is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma.Glenda is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma.Glenda has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Teofilo Ananias

texts.es:
En el sitio Santa Martha de la  parroquia Riochico en Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Querer Es Poder De Riochico. Este lugar se lo conoce por su  vegetación donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

Aquí conocimos al señor Teófilo, tiene 18 años  de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, este año termino sus estudios secundarios y espera continuar sus estudios superiores. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido empezar su negocio.

Él es un joven muy trabajador y responsable que utilizo el primer crédito para empezar un negocio de compra y venta de miel de abeja, en la finca de su papá tiene algunos panales de abejas y junto  su padre le dan el mantenimiento adecuado y la extracción de la miel cada cierto tiempo, la misma que él sale a vender a la ciudad de Portoviejo y Manta lugar donde vende muy bien sus productos y donde tiene clientes que a menudo le dejan sus productos, el también compra este producto a los vecinos que se dedican al cultivo y extracción de la miel.

Este crédito es para comprar miel de abeja para la venta diaria.

Sus sueños son seguir sus estudios y ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
At the St. Martha place located in the Riochico Portoviejo, every fifteen days the members of the community bank “to want is to be able to” from Riochico.  This place is known for its vegetation where most of the inhabitants work in agriculture. 

Here is where we met Teofilo, 18, single, lives with his parents, finished high school this year and hopes to continue with post-secondary school.  He has gone through two cycles at the community bank and likes it because thanks to the loans he was able to start his business.

He is a hardworking young man and a responsible one that used his first loan to start a business of buying and selling honey, at his father's ranch there are some honeycombs that he and his dad  take care off and extract honey from every so often, same honey that he goes to sell to the city of Portoviejo and Manta place where he sells his products very well and has clients to whom he delivers products often, he also buys honey from neighbours who are also honey farmers.

This loan is to buy honey for sale.

His dreams are to continue studying and become a professional.

loans.use: To buy honey.

loans.name: Miriam Karina

texts.es:
La Señora. Miriam es socia del banco comunal El Reencuentro, vive por un sector de la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, Baños se sitúa al pie de la Cordillera Occidental, en un sitio de irregular relieve. Esta parroquia moviliza grandes cantidades de gente, atraídos por las bondades de sus aguas termales, la majestuosidad de su templo y la fiesta de la Virgen de Guadalupe. Su gente es amable y gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, dedicándose al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Doña Miriam tiene 24 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijas de 8, 4 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

La Señora Miriam se dedica al cuidado de sus hijas pasando la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, actividad que la realiza hace un año.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para aumentar su mercadería.
 
Su meta es tener una boutique para tener un negocio más estable.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the El Reencuentro Communal Bank.  She lives in an area of the parish of Baños in Cuenca.  Baños is located at the foot of the western range of the Andes on a site of irregular relief.  Large numbers of people move through this parish attracted by the benefits of its hot springs, the majesty of its temple, and the festival of the Virgin of Guadalupe.  Its people are pleasant and kind and they maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.  The work in commerce, animal rearing, and agriculture.

Miriam is 24 years old, married, and has three daughters who are eight, four, and three years old.  Her first two daughters attend a small school in the city.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They don't own their own home, so they live in a relative's house.

Miriam spends most of her time at home taking care of her children.  In her free time she sells clothing through catalogs, which she's been doing for a year now.

This is the first loan she is taking out with the communal bank, which she was invited to join by her mother-in-law.  She will use the loan to buy clothing to add to her merchandise.

Her goal is to have a boutique to have a more stable business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 38-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani. He is a married father of four. He has been running his shop for the past four years. 

This is his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more rice, maize flour, baking flour, and washing detergents. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and improve his clothes-selling business. He hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, maize flour, baking flour, and washing detergents

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 48 years old and married to Elizabeth, a primary school teacher. They are blessed with three children, ages 14, 10 and 8. Moses is a dairy  farmer and has been supplying milk for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

Moses has joined KADET LTD through a self-help group and is now servicing a loan of 20,000 KES. This is his first loan, and he wishes to use the money to purchase dairy feeds for the animals and to improve the dairy structures on the farm. The profits will be used to plough back into the farm.

He hopes to purchase a plot and develop residential houses and also educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feeds and improve the structures on the farm

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years old, married, and the father of two children. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling goods from his retail shop. He earns a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers. He is applying for his first loan, 50,000 KES, to buy additional inventory such as baking flour, soft drinks, cooking oil, and so on to sell to his customers. 

He will use the anticipated profits to pay his children's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory such as baking flour, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Está casada con Víctor quien en agricultor, vive en compañía de sus 02 hijos y sus 02 nietos a los que quiere mucho, habitando en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Victoria es la agricultura, específicamente en la siembra de palma aceitera. Para eso cuenta con un terreno de 5 hectáreas de extensión ubicado en un caserío, donde es muy  conocida, logrando obtener una producción de la totalidad de su terreno. Lleva más de 09 años realizando esa actividad, contando con el apoyo de peones o algún contratista para que lo ayuden en la cosecha. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite contar con un ingreso permanente para solventar los gastos de su hogar así como contar con un oficio. Además de las buena rentabilidad que tiene ese negocio pues su producción es constante y los compradores también. Ahora tiene planes de ampliar las extensiones de su siembra para así tener mayores ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de estar contenta con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, así como contratar peones para la cosecha.
texts.en: Forty-three-year-old Victoria is a hardworking and dedicated woman.  She is married to Victor, who is a farmer.  She lives in her own home with her two children and her two grandchildren, whom she loves very much.  Victoria works in agriculture for a living, specifically in the growing of palm for oil.  She has a 5-ha. plot of land for growing located in a small village where she is very well known.  She is able to produce on all of her land.  She has been in this business for nine years with the help of workers or a contractor to help her with her harvest.  She likes this business because it gives her a permanent source of income to cover her household expenses and because it has given her a trade.  This business also has good profitability because the production is consistent and the buyers are too.  She currently has plans to extend her growing area to make more income.  This will be her second loan with MFP and she counts on their collaboration to continue toward her goals.  She is also happy with her communal bank because it is a close-knit group.  She will use the requested 800 nuevos soles to buy fertilizers and to hire workers for the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hire workers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Linus

texts.en:
Linus is thirty-two years old. He is married to Lucy and they have one daughter who is five years old.

Linus is a farmer and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy pesticides and upgrade the shed that shelters his animals.

He hopes to have many livestock in the future.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and upgrade his animal shed.

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerald is thirty-five years old, married, and with three children. Gerald is a mechanic in the area of Githurai. He has been in this business for the last thirteen years and gets an income of KES 30,000 per month.

He has got good credit history in KADET and is applying for his second loan of KES 80,000 from KADET Ltd. which he plans to use to buy spares and oil machines. 

He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and expand his garage. He hopes to expand his garage to a big one and educate his children

loans.use: To buy spares for his garage.

loans.name: Sara Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Sara es socia del banco comunal El Reencuentro, vive por un sector de la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, Baños se sitúa al pie de la Cordillera Occidental, en un sitio de irregular relieve. Esta parroquia moviliza grandes cantidades de gente, atraídos por las bondades de sus aguas termales, la majestuosidad de su templo y la fiesta de la Virgen de Guadalupe. Su gente es amable y gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, dedicándose al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora. Sara tiene 22 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un niño  de 3 años de edad. Su esposo es comerciante y la casa en la que vive es arrendada.

Doña Sara tiene un taller de confección desde muy joven, fabrica y comercializa pantalones jeans, en el trabaja hace 6 años de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en su negocio en la compra de materia prima como: tela, hilos, cierres, botones, etc. 

Su meta es tener un almacén para vender la ropa que fabrica.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the El Reencuentro Communal Bank.  She lives in an area of the parish of Baños in Cuenca.  Baños is located at the foot of the western range of the Andes on a site of irregular relief.  Large numbers of people move through this parish attracted by the benefits of its hot springs, the majesty of its temple, and the festival of the Virgin of Guadalupe.  Its people are pleasant and kind and they maintain the cultures and traditions of their ancestors.  The work in commerce, animal rearing, and agriculture for a living.

Sara is 22 years old, married, and has a three-year-old son.  Her husband is a storekeeper and the house they live in is rented.

Sara has had a sewing workshop since she was very young where she makes and sells jeans.  She has been doing this work for six years from Monday to Saturday without a set schedule.

This is the second loan she is taking out with the communal bank and she's going to invest it in her business by buying raw material such as fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

Her goal is to have a shop to sell the clothes she makes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is aged twenty-nine and has been in active farming for seven years in his hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya. His farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables for the local market. He is married with four children aged between eleven and three. 

Isaac has requested a loan of 100,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him venture into poultry farming. He says he will use the money to build a poultry housing unit at 60,000 KES and the rest to buy poultry birds. He adds he has gathered a lot of information on the challenges in the business and is assured of the availability of the market for his products. He says the income will help him meet family needs and more specifically educate his children.
He says poultry diseases pose the greatest challenge for the business

loans.use: To construct a poultry housing unit and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Ann is thirty-three years old, single, with one child. Ann sells vegetables like cabbages and fruits like bananas. She has been in this business for the last  two years and gets an income of KES 17,800 per month.

Ann has got good credit history in KADET and she is applying for her second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd.  which she plans to use to buy more cabbages, potatoes and bananas for sale. 

She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees. She hopes to buy a lorry for transporting supplies.

loans.use: To buy cabbages and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a twenty-nine year old man from Kapune area of Kilgoris town. He is married to Catherine and they have three children aged between seven months and six years.

Daniel runs a food kiosk, a business he has done for the last seven years. He makes a monthly income of KES 13,000. He is taking his second loan from KADET Ltd. which he will use to buy food stuff for his kiosk. His profits will be used to diversify into farming.

His dream is to have a well-stocked business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff for his kiosk.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is forty-two years old, a retail shop proprietor in Marikani. He is a divorced father of five. He has been running his shop for the past four years successfully. 

This marks his second business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. With the loan, he plans to purchase more rice, cooking fats, maize flour and washing detergents. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and educate his children. He hopes to have well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, cooking fats, maize flour and washing detergents.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is thirty-three years old. He owns a general store in Shanzu, Mombasa, and is married. He has been running this business for the past three years with great success.

This marks Johnson’s third business loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to purchase more car tires, bicycle tires and break fluid. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and to expand his business further. He hopes to buy a personal car.

loans.use: to purchase more car tires, bicycle tires and break fluid.

loans.name: Erika Yesenia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unidas Somos Más. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Erika, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años de edad. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una gran mujer que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice  en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres para lo cual los fines de semana instala un pequeño puesto en el mercado, también realiza dos a tres viajes por semana hasta la cuidad de Quito llevando todo tipo de frutas de la costa como sandias, melones, zapallo, naranjas, entre otras muchas frutas que se venden a muy buen precio en esta ciudad, allá entrega a comerciantes al por mayor, allí mismo también aprovecha para traer mercadería que vende los fines de semana. Lleva más de 6 años dedicado a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar todo tipo de frutas de la costa. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos, es la secretaria del grupo  y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo. 

Su meta es comprar un carro ya que en el que realizan sus viajes es fletado, con el cual se va una gran parte de las ganancias.
texts.en:
The members of the La Unidas Somos Más Communal Bank meet in the canton of Rocafuerte every fifteen days.  This place is known for its delicious candies, which are made by the locals and are known throughout the whole country.

This is where Erika lives.  She is 30 years old and she has a domestic partnership and a three-year-old son.  Her partner is a storekeeper.

She is a great woman who is taking out this loan for her partner to use in his business.  He sells fruits and vegetables for a living from a small stall he sets up on the weekends at the market.  He also makes two or three trips per week to the city of Quito where he takes all kinds of fruits from the coast, such as watermelons, melons, pumpkins, and oranges, among many other fruits that sell for very good prices in the city.  He makes deliveries to wholesale dealers there and he also takes advantage by bringing back merchandise that he sells on the weekends.  He has been in this business for six years and it's going very well for him.
 
She will use this loan to buy all kinds of fruits from the coast.  She has been with the communal bank for two loan cycles; she is the group's secretary; and she likes it because she has made many friends in the group.

Her goal is to buy a car because the one he uses for his trips is rented, which takes a large part of his earnings.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Ilusha

texts.en:
Ilusha is from the village of Kotelia, South Georgia. He is fifty-nine years old and lives with his wife Aghunik. The only source of income for the family is agriculture. They have two milk cows. Aghunik and Ilusha make cheese and sell it locally. Also the family owns five hectares of land, which is used for growing potatoes, barley and wheat. Harvested products are sold locally to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 150 Laris.

Ilusha requested credit to purchase additional land, which is being sold by the local government. They will be able to cultivate more land and harvest more products, which will be sold. Their income will increase and the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is a farmer in Litein South Rift, Kenya. He is aged thirty-five and married with four children aged between eight and two. He has been in farming for 10 years and currently sells his produce of milk and tea to the local market. He gets additional income from a local tea factory where he works as a casual laborer.

Noah has requested a loan of  50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy an additional dairy cow for his dairy business. He says he wants to add another dairy cow to enable him enjoy economies of scale. He adds he will use the income to expand his farming business and improve his family's living standards.

He says unreliable rainfall and unstable market prices are the greatest challenges to farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is fifty years old. He is married with nine children. He operates a posho mill, and also sells dry maize to his customers. He gets a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has been in the business for the past twenty-one years.

This is his first loan term with KADET Ltd. He will use the loan amount to purchase cereals to mill and sell as flour. 

He hopes to expand his business by opening another mill and also opening a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to mill and sell as flour.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama  is a fishmonger who also sells rice and gari at Ampanyi near Elmina. She buys fresh fish from the market, smokes it and then sells it.  She has been in this business for some years now. Ama is married to a fisherman and has three children. Ama assists her husband to feed and cloth their children. 

Ama will use her loan to purchase more fish which she will smoke and sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish which she will smoke and sell.

loans.name: Liliana Beatriz

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unidas Somos Más. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una camaronera. Ella estudio belleza en una academia de la localidad hace varios años.

La señora Liliana es una joven ama de casa que además de estará al tanto de su hogar también realiza todo tipo de trabajos de belleza que aprendió en la academia, los realiza en su casa y a domicilio, ella pinta uñas, hace tinturados y cortes de cabello entre otras cosas, poco a poco está comprando las herramientas necesarias para instalar su salón de belleza. Ella lleva más de 3 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar ciertas herramientas y materiales para su trabajo como: tintes, shampoo, fijador, esmaltes, tijeras, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos, es la presidenta del grupo  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Su meta son tener un gran salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The La Unidas Somos Mas community bank meets twice a month in the Ecuadorean canton of Rocafuerte.  Rocafuerte is known for a traditional sweet that is famous around the country.

Our member, Liliana, is 25 years old.  She is partnered and has two children, 7- and 2-years old, respectively, the oldest of whom is in school.  Liliana's partner is a truck driver.  She is a busy young woman with all of the responsibility that goes with running a household.  Even so, she has opened her own salon, applying the skills that she learned at a local beauty school several years ago.   

Liliana operates the business in a room of her house.  Among other services, she cuts and dyes hair and paints nails.  She is slowly buying the tools that she needs to operate the business.  She started the salon 3 years ago and tells us that she is happy with her progress.  

Liliana will use this loan to buy the supplies--dyes, shampoos, hairspray, nail varnish, etc.--she needs to run her business.  This is the banks' third round of funding.  Liliana is the president of the group and says that its members are supportive of one another.  

Her goal is to open a larger salon.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Huber Adrian

texts.es:
Huber es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer generar sus propios ingresos, es por esto que desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar con su padre en la carpintería que este tenía, y posteriormente pasó a manejarla directamente. Actualmente Huber se encuentra casado y es padre de una hija de 2 años a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida. Huber es reconocido gracias a que tanto su padre como el, siempre han ofrecido trabajos de muy buena calidad, y gracias a esto Huber tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que le hacen muy buenos pedidos. Actualmente Huber tiene un pedido de un cliente suyo muy numeroso, por lo que requiere comprar materia prima para poderlo elaborar, sin embargo, Huber no cuenta con mucho dinero disponible, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materiales como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros para la elaboración de un pedido que le ha hecho un cliente.

Huber espera que de esta manera pueda seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia y poder mejorarle la calidad de vida. Además, sueña con que su familia pueda gozar de mejores capacidades económicas y su hija en un futuro pueda ingresar a una educación de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Huber is a very hard-working person, and he has always wanted to generate his own income.  That is why, at a very young age, he started working with his father in the carpentry shop that he had.  He later managed it personally.

Huber is now married and has a two year old daughter.  He has always wanted to give them a good quality of life.  Huber is known, thanks to his father as much as himself, for always offering very good quality work.  Thanks to this Huber has a lot of customers who place very good orders with him.

Huber currently has a very large order from one of his customers.  He needs to buy to raw material to be able to manufacture it.  However, Huber does not have much available money.  That is why he has the hope that a loan will give him to opportunity to buy materials like wood, glue, and nails, among others in order to produce the order his customer has made.

Huber hopes that this way he will be able to continue generating the needed income to support his family and to be able to improve their quality of life.  Also, he dreams that his family will be able to enjoy improved financial means.  He dreams that in the future his daughter will be able to have a good quality education.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, glue, and nails, among others in order to produce the order his customer has made.

loans.name: Silvana

texts.es:
Emprendedora es la mejor palabra con la que se puede caracterizar a Silvana; una joven de 19 años que acabó de terminar un curso técnico de contabilidad y finanzas y ahora, gracias a la gente que conoció en este, quiere montar un negocio de venta de mercancía como ropa y joyas con el ánimo de generar sus ingresos. Silvana proviene de una vereda cercana a su municipio, pero se mudó hacia el municipio de Yarumal con el ánimo de buscar mejores oportunidades de progreso. En este municipio vive con su hermano y desde allí ha empezado a proyectar su futuro. Silvana quiere montar este negocio porque la gente que conoció en el curso la animó para que vendiera mercancía, el principal argumento era que allí tendría una gran cantidad de clientes para atender.

Debido a que Silvana no cuenta con un gran capital para poder comprar la mercancía que ofrecerá a sus clientes, Silvana busca un préstamo que le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de mercancía de ropa y joyas con el ánimo de poder empezar su negocio.

Silvana espera que de esta manera su negocio se ponga en marcha y pueda así generar sus propios ingresos y colaborar con su hermano en el sostenimiento del hogar. Además, espera poder contribuirle a sus padres con una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas. Silvana sueña con tener un gran negocio, con continuar estudiando y ser una gran profesional y en un futuro forjar una familia.
texts.en:
"Enterprising" is the best word to describe Silvana, a 19-year-old young lady who just finished a technical course in accounting and finance and who now, thanks to the people she met in that course, wants to set up a business selling merchandise such as clothing and jewelry in order to make money.  Silvana is from an area nearby her municipality, but she moved to the municipality of Yarumal to seek out better opportunities for progress.  She lives with her brother in this municipality and it's where she has started to plan her future.  Silvana wants to set up this business because the people she met in her course motivated her to sell merchandise.  Their main argument was that she would have a large number of customers to serve there.

Because Silvana doesn't have a lot of capital to buy the merchandise she will offer her customers, she's looking for a loan that will give her the opportunity to obtain clothing and jewelry merchandise in order to start her business.

Silvana hopes that this will get her business started and that she will be able to make her own income and work with her brother maintain their home.  She also hopes to be able to contribute to giving her parents a better quality of life and better financial opportunities.  Silvana dreams of having a large business, continuing her studies, being a successful professional, and, in the future, starting a family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry merchandise to start her business

loans.name: Sofia Aurora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unidas Somos Más. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Sofía, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10 y 8  años y un bebé de 7 meses de edad. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, dos veces por semana se desplazan hasta la ciudad de La Latacunga, en esta ciudad entregan sus productos a comerciantes tanto al por mayor como al menudeo, ellos llevan todo  tipo de frutas de la costa como: sandias, melones, papayas, naranjas, además de legumbres como: habas, habichuelas, tomates, entre otros productos que se venden a muy buen precio en esta ciudad. Llevan más de 2 años que se dedican a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
p>
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar verduras, tomates, melones, piñas, entre otras frutas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. 

Su meta es comprar un carro para realizar sus viajes.

En la foto está la socia con su bebé.
texts.en:
The La Unidas Somos Mas community bank meets twice a month in the Ecuadorean canton of Rocafuerte.  Rocafuerte is known for a traditional sweet that is famous around the country.

Our member, Sofia, is 30 years old.  She is partnered and has three children: 10-years, 8-years and 7-months old, respectively.  Sofia's partner is a merchant and they operate a produce sales business together.  

Sofia and her partner travel to the city of La Latacunga twice a week to sell their produce there.  They take all kinds of fruits--watermelons, honeydew melons, papayas, oranges--and vegetables--broad beans, green beans, tomatoes--to sell.  Their customers include both everyday buyers and wholesalers.  Sofia says that they have operated the business for 2 years and are happy with their progress.  

Sofia will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her produce business.  This is the bank's third round of funding and Sofia says that the loans she's received have helped her a lot.

Her goal for the future is to buy a "carro" for moving her produce to market.

You can see Sofia in the photo with her baby.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that she will resell.

loans.name: Juan Del Mar

texts.es:
Juan se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas. Aprendió la actividad empíricamente, gracias a que desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar en talleres de reparación donde iba aprendiendo. Desde hace 2 años decidió independizarse y montar en su casa un taller de mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas. Gracias a esto, Juan genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive solo con su hijo de 16 años, pues su madre se separó de ellos hace un tiempo. Juan es reconocido en la región por la buena calidad de sus servicios, y gracias a esto su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco. 

Debido a que tiene gran volumen de trabajo, Juan requiere de la compra de algunos repuestos para las motocicletas, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de repuestos para motocicleta como son bujías, empaquetadoras, bandas para frenos, bombillería, etc.

Juan espera que de esta manera pueda continuar ejerciendo su trabajo y sus clientes sigan quedando satisfechos con sus servicios. Además, espera que sus ingresos le permitan brindarle a su hijo una mejor educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Juan sueña con tener un gran taller el cual pueda generar empleo y sea reconocido en su región, y con el cual le pueda brindar a su hijo una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juan has worked for a great part of his life maintaining and repairing motorcycles. He learned this trade by working in it, thanks to the fact that at a very early age, he began to work in repair shops where he gradually learned. Two years ago he decided to become independent and set up a motorcycle maintenance and repair shop in his home. Thanks to this, Juan generates the necessary income to sustain his household, where he lives with just his 16-year-old son, since his mother separated from them some time ago. Juan is known in his region for the good quality of his services, and thanks to this, his business has been growing little by little.

Because he has a large volume of work, Juan needs to buy some spare parts for the motorcycles. For this reason he hopes that the loan will offer him the opportunity to purchase spare parts for motorcycles such as spark plugs, gaskets, brake pads, headlights, etc.

Juan hopes that in this way he can continue practicing his trade and his customers will continue to be satisfied with his services. In addition, he hopes that his income will allow him to offer his son a good education and a better quality of life. Juan dreams of having a large shop where he could generate employment and be known in his region, and with which he could offer his son an economically stable life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles, such as spark plugs, gaskets, brake pads, headlights, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
